message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
driver.get("http://www.rediff.com/");
WebElement sign = driver.findElement(By.xpath("//html/body/div[3]/div[3]/span[4]/span/a"));
sign.click();
Set<String> windowHandles = driver.getWindowHandles();
Iterator<String> iterator = windowHandles.iterator();
String mainWindowHandle = iterator.next();
String popUpWindowHandle = iterator.next();
driver.switchTo().window(popUpWindowHandle);
WebElement email_id= driver.findElement(By.xpath("//*[@id='signin_info']/a[1]"));
email_id.sendKeys("hi");
<<<explanation>>>: The getWindowHandles() method returns a set of window handles which can be used to iterate over all open windows of this WebDriver instance by passing a handle to the switchTo().window() method. You can use Iterator.next() to get the handle of the next window. In your case, the first handle is the main window and the second handle is the pop-up window.
